## Discussion

Calling this function in Objective-C increments the current count of outstanding tasks in the group. Using this function (with [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchGroup/leave()]) allows your application to properly manage the task reference count if it explicitly adds and removes tasks from the group by a means other than using the [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/dispatch_group_async] function. A call to this function must be balanced with a call to [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchGroup/leave()]. You can use this function to associate a block with more than one group at the same time.

# enter()

**Instance Method**

Explicitly indicates that a block has entered the group.

## Declaration

```swift
func enter()
```

## Discussion

Calling this function in Objective-C increments the current count of outstanding tasks in the group. Using this function (with [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchGroup/leave()]) allows your application to properly manage the task reference count if it explicitly adds and removes tasks from the group by a means other than using the [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/dispatch_group_async] function. A call to this function must be balanced with a call to [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchGroup/leave()]. You can use this function to associate a block with more than one group at the same time.

## Updating the Group Manually

- **leave()**: Explicitly indicates that a block in the group finished executing.
